roleset.name: flip through pages

role.descr: agent, person flipping through the pages
thing being searched for in the pages

example.name: All arguments
example.text: He leafed through the Playbill for that show.

example.name: common example, Args 0-1
example.text: [The angry cop]-1 began *trace*-1 leafing through her IDs and credit cards as if they were junk mail.
example.arg: through her IDs and credit cards
as if they were junk mail.

example.name: passive
example.text: They-1 had been leafed through *trace*-1 by many students who had been assigned them in the past.
example.arg: by many students who had been assigned them in the past.

roleset.note: Roleset based on internet search and wordnet. Added because none existed. Member of Vncls 35.5. Comparison to 'search'. Roleset by Julia.

roleset.name: grow leaves

role.descr: final state of the thing once it has leaves, 'into __'

example.name: All arguments
example.text: The tree in her yard had leafed into a pale green globe.
example.arg: The tree in her yard had leafed into a pale green globe.

example.name: intransitive with location
example.text: The damage of the winter past was evident in trees leafing only above the reach of deer.
example.arg: only above the reach of deer.

example.name: Metaphorical
example.text: Lieutenant Minver, two hundred yards away, would see the huge door leafing open.

roleset.note: Roleset based on internet search and wordnet. Added because none existed. No Vncls. Comparison to 'branch'. Roleset by Julia.
